test-suite.comment: Test suite for the ALMA-OT GUI (automated with QF-Test).
test-suite.author: Peter Kratzer

dependency.name: Test Suite Dependencies
dependency.comment: Basic setup for automated ALMA-OT tests (test data base enabled, password for advanced user available, ...).

package.name: almaot
package.comment: Stored procedures for testing the ALMA-OT GUI.
package.author: Peter Kratzer

dependency.name: Preparations
dependency.comment: Setup the test environment (done only once when PreparationsDone = false ).
dependency.author: Peter Kratzer

dependency.name: AlmaOT

comment.p: Client (ALMA-OT) startup and shutdown are handled.
Startup includes setting a number of variables to facilitate the access to the test directory and its contained data, project and work subdirectories.

dependency.result:
TESTDIR_ROOT (global variable). Set to the parent directory of the test suite location.
TESTDIR_DATA (global variable). Set to the data directory contained in the test module.
TESTDIR_DATA_PDF (global variable). Set to the pdf subdirectory in the data directory of the test module.
TESTDIR_DATA_PROJ (global variable). Set to the projet subdirectory in the data directory of the test module.
TESTDIR_WORK (global variable). Set to the work directory contained in the test module.
dependency.author: Peter Kratzer

dependency.name: MenuesDialogsClosed
dependency.comment: A program state where all menus and dialogs are closed is ensured.
dependency.author: Peter Kratzer

dependency.name: PreferencesDialog
dependency.comment: Opening and closing the preferences dialog is handled.
dependency.param: If this optional parameter is provided the specified tab (within the preferences dialog) is selected.
dependency.author: Peter Kratzer

dependency.name: DataBaseUser
dependency.comment: A data base setting with specified (user, passwd) is applied in the preferences.
dependency.param: ALMA ID for data base test user.
Password for data base test user.
dependency.author: Peter Kratzer

dependency.name: AdvancedUser
dependency.comment: Advanced user settings are enabled or disabled. The procedure is executed only if the new setting differs from the previous one as memorised in the global variable AdvancedUserActive.
dependency.param: Specifies whether advanced user option is to be enabled or disabled.
dependency.result: New setting is memorised in global variable AdvancedUserActive for optimisation.
dependency.author: Peter Kratzer

dependency.name: WorkingDirectory
dependency.comment: The existence of the working directory is ensured. The working directory's location is expected in the global variable TESTDIR_WORK.
dependency.result:
The specified working directory is created if it does not exist.
The working directory's write permissions are set for the user (owner) only.
A UserException is thrown if the working directory does not exist and cannot be created.
dependency.author: Peter Kratzer

dependency.name: ReadFile
dependency.comment: Existence and read permission for the specified file are ensured.
dependency.param: Name of the file whose existence and readability has to be guarantueed.
dependency.result: A UserException is thrown if the required file does not exist.
dependency.author: Peter Kratzer

dependency.name: WriteFile
dependency.comment: Write permission for the specified file is ensured. An existing file with the specified name is cleaned up.
dependency.param: Name of the file whose writability has to be guarantueed.
dependency.result: A UserException is thrown if the required file cannot be written and/or deleted.
dependency.author: Peter Kratzer

dependency.name: Perspective
dependency.comment: The specified perspective setting is ensured. An actual setting is performed only if it differs from the previous setting.
dependency.author: Peter Kratzer

package.name: exec
package.comment: Handling of the ALMA-OT client execution and external shell scripts.
package.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: joinPath
procedure.comment: Join path components using the operating-system-specific path separator.
procedure.param: 1st path component (string).
2nd path component (string).
3rd path component (string), optional.
4th path component (string), optional.
5th path component (string), optional.
procedure.return: Joint path (string).
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: escapeEmailAddress
procedure.comment: The at sign '@' in email address is escaped for entry selection since it is a reserved character in QF-Test.
procedure.param: Email address (string).
procedure.return: String with escaped at sign.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: escapeRegExp
procedure.comment: Some special characters are escaped since they are reserved characters in QF-Test (e.g. used for component names).
procedure.param: Input string.
procedure.return: String with escaped at sign.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: runOT
procedure.comment: The client program (ALMA-OT) is started and a row of messages and warnings appearing before the main window are handled.
procedure.param: Flag (boolean) if a login dialog for advanced users is canceled or provided with valid login data.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: stopOT

comment.p: The client program (ALMA-OT) is stopped.

Depending on the provided option unsaved project data is saved or discarded. If the client does not terminate within the timeout period the process is forcibly terminated. When the option "cancel" is given the client is not stopped.

procedure.param: One of the values (save, quit, cancel). Default value: quit.
File name in conjunction with the option 'save'. Optional parameter.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: createWorkingCopy

comment.p: The specified source file is copied to the specified target file. If no target is specified the file is copied to the working directory with identical name.
This function is useful to protect the source file from being accidentally overwritten, in particular when save functions are used which do not accept a target file name.

procedure.param: Source file name.
File name of the working copy.
procedure.return: Flag whether the working copy was successfully created.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: patchPreferencesFile
procedure.comment: The preferences file (containing the persistent settings) is patched for usage with the test submission service (effective only until ALMA release 9.0.5) and window position and size.
procedure.param:
Archive (data base) address to be set as default.
Example: http://ite2.hq.eso.org:8180
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: removePersistentSettings
procedure.comment: The persistent settings' directory .almaot is removed (saved with a timestamp).
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: showACSTag
procedure.comment: The content of the file $ACSROOT/ACS_TAG is shown in a log message so it may be retrieved from the test's runlog.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: showBuildTag
procedure.comment: The content of the file $ACSROOT/BUILD_TAG is shown in a log message so it may be retrieved from the test's runlog.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: showTestSuiteVersion
procedure.comment: The test suite's repository version information is written to the logging system so it may be retrieved from the test's runlog.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: getAlmaOTVersion
procedure.comment: The ALMA-OT version information is extracted from the "About" dialog.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: checkSubmissionService

comment.p: Reachability and accessibility of the submission service via the provided user credentials are verified.
Sets the global variable Telescope if autoselect is used.

procedure.param:
Submission service web address.
Example: http://gas01:8180
User name.
Password.
Flag (boolean) whether to throw exceptions in case of errors.
Flag (boolean) whether this check expects an inactive user.
procedure.return: Flag (boolean) to indicate the submission service's status.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: getJavaVersionFile
procedure.comment: The Java version information is extracted from the file created by the script "run_test.sh".
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: getStandAloneAlmaOTTag
procedure.comment: The tag of a stand-alone ALMA-OT is extracted from the file BUILD_TAG under .../work/ot_inst/.
procedure.return: Build-tag (string).
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

package.name: math
package.comment: Mathematical procedures exceeding already available standard functionality.
package.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: getNumericValue
procedure.comment: The numeric value is extracted from a string containing value and unit spearated by a blank.
procedure.param: Value with optional unit (separated by blank).
procedure.return: Numeric value without unit.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: getUnitString
procedure.comment: The unit is extracted from a string containing value and unit spearated by a blank.
procedure.param: Value with optional unit (separated by blank).
procedure.return: Unit string without the numeric value. An empty string is returned if the input value does not contain any unit.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: equalDecimals
procedure.comment: Two given numbers (including their optional units) are compared with the specified accuracy. Different magnitudes of the same unit (e.g. MHz and GHz) are not converted automatically.
procedure.param: First value (including optional units) (string).
Second value (including optional units) (string).
Desired accuracy in powers of 10.
procedure.return: Flag (boolean) whether the two values are equal given the specified accuracy.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: getSkyFreq
procedure.comment: The sky frequency is computed for the given rest frequency and redshift z.
procedure.param: Rest frequency with optional unit.
Redshift value z.
procedure.return: Sky frequency, including unit if contained in the rest frequency input parameter (string).
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: getRestFreq
procedure.comment: The rest frequency is computed for the given sky frequency and redshift z.
procedure.param: Sky frequency with optional unit.
Redshift value z.
procedure.return: Rest frequency, including unit if contained in the sky frequency input parameter (string).
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: openPrefs
procedure.comment: The preferences dialog window is opened (if not yet available).
procedure.return: Flag (boolean) indicating the availability of the preference dialog.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: openPrefsTab
procedure.comment: The preferences dialog window is opened (if not yet available) and the specified tab activated.
procedure.return: Flag (boolean) indicating the availability of the selected tab in the preference dialog.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: closePrefs
procedure.comment: The preferences window is closed.
procedure.param: Value true closes the preferences dialog using the "OK" button, confirming any changes. Otherwise (value false) the "Cancel" button is used, discarding all changes not yet applied.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: selectAdvancedUserFeatures
procedure.comment: The "Advanced User" features are enabled or disabled in the "Preferences" dialog.
procedure.param: Flag (boolean) whether the "Advanced User" features are to be enabled or disabled.
Flag (boolean) whether the change is applied immediately using the "Apply" button.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: selectDB

comment.p: The data base (archive) is selected via the "Preferences" dialog.

Prerequisites:
- Preferences dialog window is open.
- Tab "Connection" is active.

procedure.param: Flag (boolean) whether the change is applied immediately using the "Apply" button.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

comment.p: The data base password is entered in the "Preferences" dialog.

Prerequisites:
- Preferences dialog window is open.
- Tab "Connection" is active.

procedure.name: changeDBUserPasswd
procedure.comment: The data base user name and password are changed if the specified value(s) differ(s) from the current settings.
procedure.param: User name (ALMA ID) to be used for login.
Password to be used for login.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: checkDBUser

comment.p: The user name setting in the "Preferences" dialog is cross-checked with the specified user name.

Prerequisites:
- Preferences dialog window is open.
- Tab "Connection" is active.

procedure.param: User name (ALMA ID) expected in the settings.
Flag (boolean) whether to create a log message in case of an error.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: handleLoginDialog
procedure.comment: For a specified time period the procedure waits for the login dialog and in case it appears the provided login data is entered and the dialog closed.
procedure.param: User name (ALMA ID) to be used if the login dialog appears.
Password to be used if the login dialog appears.
The timeout value is used for waiting if the login dialog appears within the specified period.
procedure.return: Flag (boolean) indicating the occurrence of an error.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: switchUser

comment.p: The user settings are switched in preferences.

Side-effects:
Setting of global variable AdvancedUserActive as a flag to indicate the currently active selection.

procedure.param: User name (ALMA ID).
Password for the specified user.
Flag (boolean) for advanced user features.
procedure.return: Flag (boolean) indicating a successful switch.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: selectPerspective
procedure.comment: The ALMA-OT perspective is set to the specified value.
procedure.param: Permitted values: (1, 2) as provided in the selection dialog.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: selectScienceGoalSummaryView
procedure.comment: The science goal summary view is selected.
procedure.param: Value table selects the summary table, value editors selects all its page editors
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: selectBLCorrelatorForACA
procedure.comment: The "BL Correlator for ACA SBs" feature is enabled or disabled in the "Preferences" dialog.
procedure.param: Flag (boolean) whether the "BL Correlator for ACA SBs" feature is to be enabled or disabled.
Flag (boolean) whether the change is applied immediately using the "Apply" button.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: checkColourSetting

comment.p: The RGB colour settings in the preferences are checked for the specified feature.

Prerequisites:
- Preferences dialog window is open.
- Tab "Colours" is active.

procedure.param: Button component name in preferences for specified feature.
Value ([0...255]) for RGB component "red".
Value ([0...255]) for RGB component "green".
Value ([0...255]) for RGB component "blue".
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: changeColourSetting
procedure.comment: The RGB colour settings in the preferences are changed for the specified feature. Empty values for any colour leave the respective component unchanged.
procedure.param: Button component name in preferences for specified feature.
Value ([0...255]) for RGB component "red".
Value ([0...255]) for RGB component "green".
Value ([0...255]) for RGB component "blue".
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

comment.p: Handling of project-specific operations.

General procedures suitable for both proposals (phase 1 projects) and programs (phase 2 projects) are located directly in this package, specific procedures are handled in their respective subpackage project or program.

procedure.name: selectProjectTab
procedure.comment: The tab for the selected project type is selected.
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
procedure.throws: If the project type is not one of the valid parameter values.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: getTabID
procedure.comment: The component ID for the specified project type is determined.
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
procedure.return: Component ID of project tab.
procedure.throws: If the project type is not one of the valid parameter values.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: getTreePath
procedure.comment: The second level tree path for the specified project type is determined.
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
procedure.return: Tree path for level 2, interpreted as a regular expression. Examples: /.*/Proposal, /.*/Science Plan.
procedure.throws: If the project type is not one of the valid parameter values.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: getTreePathDetail
procedure.comment: The third level tree path for the specified project type is determined.
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
procedure.return: Tree path for detail on level 3, interpreted as a regular expression. Examples: /.*/Proposal/Planned Observing, /.*/Science Plan/Special Observing Program.
procedure.throws: If the project type is not one of the valid parameter values.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: handleUnsavedChangesDialog
procedure.comment: For a specified time period the procedure waits for the dialog warning about unsaved changes and in case it appears the changes are commited or discarded.
procedure.param: Flag (boolean) specifying whether to commit (save) the unsaved changes (using button "Save") or discard them (using button "Discard").
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: handleSubmissionDialog
procedure.comment: For a specified time period the procedure waits for the warning dialog regarding differences in the current cycle and the proposal's original cycle.
procedure.param: Flag (boolean) specifying whether to confirm the dialog (using button "Yes") or to deny the request (using button "No").
Flag (boolean) specifying whether the appearance of the warning is mandatory.
procedure.return: Flag (boolean) whether the dialog handling was successful.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: openProjectFinder
procedure.comment: The project finder dialog is opened via menu "File / Open Project". The procedure waits within the specified timeout period until the dialog window is open.
procedure.throws: If the project finder dialog does not open within the timeout period.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: handleUpgradeRequiredDialog
procedure.comment: For a specified time period the procedure waits for the dialog warning about an upgrade required for the loaded project and in case it appears the necessary actions are performed.
procedure.param: Flag (boolean) specifying whether to confirm the dialog (using button "Yes") or to deny the request (using button "No").
Flag (boolean) specifying whether the upgrade warning is mandatory.
procedure.return: Flag (boolean) whether the dialog handling was successful.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

comment.p: The project finder dialog is closed using the "Done" button.

Prerequisites:
The project finder dialog must be open.

procedure.name: openFromDisk
procedure.comment: The project specified by file name is loaded from disk. A basic check is performed to verify the success.
procedure.param: File name (fully qualified path) of project on disk.
Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program, Test). The type Test performs a special test run.
Flag (boolean) whether the opened proposal must ask for an upgrade.
Flag (boolean) whether an upgarde request is granted (upgradeResponse=true) or denied (upgradeResponse=false).
Flag (boolean) whether possible errors shall be logged in the run-log.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: saveToDisk
procedure.comment: The project is saved to disk with the specified file name.
procedure.param: Target file name (fully qualified path) of project on disk.
Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program, Test). The type Test performs a special test run.
Flag (boolean) whether an existing file with the target file name should be overwritten.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: saveToDiskWithFileCheck
procedure.comment: The project is saved to disk with the specified file name and the existence of the created file is verified.
procedure.param: Target file name (fully qualified path) of project on disk.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: openFromDB
procedure.comment: The specified project is loaded from the data base (archive). If the result is ambiguous (more than one matches) then the latest entry (by creation time) is selected. Additionally, if "ProjectCode" is selected, an error message is logged.
procedure.param: Search type. One of the values (ProjectCode, AlmaID, ProjectName, All).
Search parameter.
Flag (boolean) if result is to be awaited.
procedure.return: Flag (boolean) if project was opened successfully.
procedure.throws: If the selector is not one of the valid parameter values.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: getTemplateLibraryTree
procedure.comment: The tree component for the specified project type's template library is determined.
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
procedure.return: Tree component for template library.
procedure.throws: If the project type is not one of the valid parameter values.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: showTemplateLibrary
procedure.comment: The template library is displayed or hidden.
procedure.param: Flag (boolean) whether to show (show=true) or hide (show=false) the template library.
procedure.throws: If the tab (should be either the proposal or the program tab) name cannot be determined automatically.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: selectTemplateLibraryScienceGoal

comment.p: The specified science goal from the template library is selected.

Prerequisites:
- The template library must be already open.

procedure.param: Name of the science goal in the library to be selected.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: useAsTemplate
procedure.comment: The specified project file is used as template.
procedure.param: Fully qualified file name of the project to be used as template.
procedure.return: Flag (boolean) whether the requested file was loaded as template.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: handleInfoBox
procedure.comment: For a specified time period the procedure waits for the info message window and in case it appears the dialog is closed by pressing the OK button.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: handleWarningBox
procedure.comment: For a specified time period the procedure waits for the warning message window and in case it appears the dialog is closed by pressing the OK button.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: setTitle
procedure.comment: The title of a project of the specified type (Proposal or Program) is set with added time stamp. A previous setting is overwritten.
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
New title for the current project.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: getTitle
procedure.comment: The title of a project of the specified type (Proposal or Program) is returned.
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
procedure.return: Project title (string).
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: setPI
procedure.comment: The project's PI is set.
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
ALMA ID of the new PI.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: setCoI
procedure.comment: A CoI is added to the current project.
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
ALMA ID of the new CoI.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: removeAllCoI
procedure.comment: All CoI's are removed from the current project.
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: setInvestigatorExecutive
procedure.comment: The executive for the specified user is set. This works only for specific users, currently only for Taiwanese.
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
ALMA ID of the investigator to be adapted.
Executive to be set for specified user. One of the values (North America, East Asia, 50\% NA 50\% EA).
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: checkTreePathExists
procedure.comment: The existence of the specified path in the tree view is verified.
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
Tree view path (alphanumerical). Regular expressions are permitted.
procedure.return: Flag (boolean) if the specified path exists in the tree view.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: selectScienceGoal
procedure.comment: The specified science goal node is selected. This procedure acts as a single entry point for the science goal selection to handle possible changes in the node's representation.
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
Science goal name.
Section sub-node (optional). One of the values (General, Field Setup, Spectral Setup, Calibration Setup, Control and Performance).
Flag (boolean) if the science goal to be selected consists of a calibrator.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: selectScienceGoalGeneral
procedure.comment: The specified sub-node "General" of a given science goal node is selected. This procedure acts as a single entry point for the science goal selection to handle possible changes in the node's representation.
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
Science goal name.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: selectScienceGoalFieldSetup
procedure.comment: The specified sub-node "Field Setup" of a given science goal node is selected. This procedure acts as a single entry point for the science goal selection to handle possible changes in the node's representation.
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
Science goal name.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: selectScienceGoalSpectralSetup
procedure.comment: The specified sub-node "Spectral Setup" of a given science goal node is selected. This procedure acts as a single entry point for the science goal selection to handle possible changes in the node's representation.
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
Science goal name.
Flag (boolean) if the science goal to be selected consists of a calibrator.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: selectScienceGoalCalibrationSetup
procedure.comment: The specified sub-node "Calibration Setup" of a given science goal node is selected. This procedure acts as a single entry point for the science goal selection to handle possible changes in the node's representation.
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
Science goal name.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: selectScienceGoalCtrlPerf
procedure.comment: The specified sub-node "Control and Performance" of a given science goal node is selected. This procedure acts as a single entry point for the science goal selection to handle possible changes in the node's representation.
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
Science goal name.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: selectScienceGoalTechJust
procedure.comment: The specified sub-node "Technical Justification" of a given science goal node is selected. This procedure acts as a single entry point for the science goal selection to handle possible changes in the node's representation.
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
Science goal name.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: checkScienceGoalName
procedure.comment: The existence of the science goal specified by name is verified.
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
Science goal name.
procedure.return: Flag (boolean) if the specified science goal exists.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: renameScienceGoal
procedure.comment: The specified science goal is renamed. To enable correct handling every science goal must have a distinctive and unique name (not "Science Goal").
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
Old science goal name.
New science goal name.
procedure.throws: If a science goal with the new name exists already. Please note, that this is not a condition demanded by the ALMA-OT. The uniqueness of all science goal names is merely a convention used within this test suite to enable an unambiguous selection in the project tree by name.
If the science goal with the old name does not exist.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: addScienceGoal
procedure.comment: A new science goal is added to the current project. To enable correct handling the new science goal must have a distinctive and unique name (not "Science Goal").
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
Science goal name.
procedure.throws: If a science goal with the same name exists already. Please note, that this is not a condition demanded by the ALMA-OT. The uniqueness of all science goal names is merely a convention used within this test suite to enable a selection in the project tree by name.
If the project type is invalid.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: deleteScienceGoal
procedure.comment: The specified science goal is deleted from the current project.
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
Science goal name.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: setScienceGoalGeneral
procedure.comment: Values for the specified science goal's subnode "General" are set.
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
Science goal name.
New description of the science goal.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: setScienceGoalCoordinates

comment.p: The coordinates for field setup are filled in. If a message box appears containing a warning that no coordinate conversion was performed this message is confirmed.

Prerequisites:
- This procedure assumes the field setup of a science goal is opened and the target tab (if several sources are contained in the selected science goal) is active.

procedure.param: Coordinate system.
Flag (boolean) for sexagesimal coordinates. Optional parameter.
Coordinates RA. Optional parameter.
Coordinates Dec. Optional parameter.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: resolveTargetName

comment.p: The target name is resolved for the currently active science goal/target.

Prerequisites:
- The field setup node is selected and the target tab for the target to be resolved is already opened.

procedure.param: Flag (boolean) whether to reset the name for an unresolvable target.
Flag (boolean) whether to expect errors. If true, no errors are logged.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: setScienceGoalSourceName

comment.p: Set the source name for the selected science goal's field setup.

Prerequisites:
- This procedure assumes the field setup of a science goal is opened and the target tab (if several sources are contained in the selected science goal) is active.

procedure.param: Source name.
Flag (boolean) whether the source name is to be resolved automatically.
Flag (boolean) how to react to a failed source name resolution.
Flag (boolean) whether to expect a resolution error. If true, no error message is generated.
procedure.return: Flag (boolean) whether the setting (and resolution if selected) was successful.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: setScienceGoalFieldSetup
procedure.comment: The basic field setup source parameters are entered for the selected science goal.

Science goal name.
Object type. One of the values (source, solar).
Source name.
Flag (boolean) whether the source name is to be resolved automatically.
Coordinate system.
Flag (boolean) for sexagesimal coordinates. Optional parameter.
Coordinates RA. Optional parameter.
Coordinates Dec. Optional parameter.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer

procedure.name: setScienceGoalFieldSetupVelocity
procedure.comment: The basic field setup velocity parameters are entered for the selected science goal.
procedure.param: Project type. One of the values (Proposal, Program).
Science goal name.
Source velocity (numerical value). Optional parameter.
Source velocity (speed unit). Optional parameter.
Source velocity (system). Optional parameter.
Redshift value (z). Optional parameter.
Doppler type. Optional parameter.
procedure.author: Peter Kratzer
